chargeHist.descr: Violate No Contact Court Order (Misdemeanor Conviction)
Violate No Contact Court Order (Misdemeanor Conviction)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Oliver Rivas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.  May not have contact with victim - except for visitation w/child thru 3rd party, unless otherwise permitted by the agent.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to Count 2.
To run consecutive to 21CF1135 & 21CF1142.

records.addlTxt: Released as to this file only
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge - Cts 2 & 3

11:01 AM Defendant Oliver Rivas appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Amended Information filed, reading waived and defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 2-Misd Battery-DA & Ct 3-Misd DC-DA, both Repeaters;
Found guilty by the court; Cts 1 & 4 were dismissed and read-in on State's motion.
Cts 2 & 3:
Court orders withheld sentence; 
Defendant placed on concurrent probation for 12 months w/conditions;
To run consecutive to 21CF1135 & 21CF1142.
No sentence credit given.
Court costs ordered; no restitution requested.
Submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
Appeal rights given.

08:35 AM
Defendant, Oliver Rivas, appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.
Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  DAR Reporter:  Amanda Chentnik.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, def. has 2 cases that he was revoked on and would like to do all 3 cases together.
Def. atty to contact PO agent to have them file the revocation order, warrant and packet for 21CF1135 & 21CF1142.
Matter set over, bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing rescheduled for May 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Oliver Rivas appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.  Defendant in custody.
Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.

Matter set over, bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing rescheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:17 AM
Defendant Oliver Rivas appeared by phone means and in-custody.
Attorney Terry William Rose in court for Defendant Oliver Rivas.
Prosecuting Atty Zachary L Brost appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, possible resolution.
Matter set over, bond continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Oliver Rivas appeared with Attorney Terry William Rose.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:    ST called witness KPD Ofc Albert Gonzales; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Rose. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 09:15 am.
